utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in here today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I just started having, um, difficulty with breathing um, starting yesterday. And I also developed this cough um, yesterday morning.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, so did, did the cough come first or the breathing, difficulty breathing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Kind of around the same time when I woke up in the morning.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And did it wake you up from sleep at all? Like did you wake up trying to catch a breath or anything?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, so it happened after you had woken up and gotten out of bed. And um, so, can you describe your cough a little bit? Is it wet or is it dry?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, it's just um, it's just a dry cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, you're not bringing up any sputum or any other material?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And uh, are you coughing up any blood by any chance?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: For the shortness of breath, can you describe it a little bit? Is it, are you having trouble taking deep breaths, or are you breathing faster? Can you describe it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I just feel like um, I'm getting out of breath really easily, just like um, walking even, walking to the kitchen from my bedroom, I'm getting short of breath and it, it just started yesterday morning, it's so odd.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and have you had anything like this happen before to you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. Were you doing anything before it started? Like were you doing any, any activities or any, are were you doing any exertions at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I was just uh, I, I slept in, I slept in a bit more than usual, um, and I was feeling quite um, drowsy. My, my doc increased my pain meds and I took the first dose um, yesterday night, um, I actually took an extra pill um, um, of the morphine um, and yeah, I don't know, maybe it, it's an allergic reaction to the morphine.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you had any allergic reactions before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And so you took an extra morphine last night and then went to sleep. Um, did you wake up coughing or catching your breath or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I actually, I ended up waking up at 1:00 PM or 2:00 PM, I was just very drowsy and uh, I think I, I think I might have taken a bit too much, I don't know. The, the arthritis pain was just killing me last night and I thought taking an extra pill would help.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And is this, are your symptoms constant? Or do they come and go?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: They're constant for the past two days. I've also noticed that I have, my breath just smells really bad. I don't know why.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Is that something you noticed recently or in the last two days?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, since yesterday. Actually, not even yesterday, this morning I would say.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: This morning, okay. Um, and is there anything that makes your symptoms worse? Like does lying down make your symptoms worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not really.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. How about exerting yourself, does it make your symptoms worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Um, do you have any other symptoms like any fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I checked my fever last night, it was um, 37.2.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, so you didn't have a fever last night, okay. Um, do you have any other symptoms like dizziness uh, any fainting spells?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. How about sore throat, headaches, muscle pain, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And um, have you been traveling at all recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any contact with anyone who has been sick recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. Uh, any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Any night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, any swelling in your legs or arms, hands?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No. No, I haven't noticed any of that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any fatigue? Just feeling more tired today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Maybe a little bit.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Have you been having any cold-like symptoms before the two days, like in the last week, like runny nose, sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No. I was, like, I was absolutely fine.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Um, how about, do you have any changes in your bowel movements like constipation, diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. Any trouble with urinating?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, any sleep or appetite issues?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Have you lost uh, significant weight in the last few months?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Um, have you been exposed to anyone who may have had tuberculosis?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, and uh, do you have any pets or animals at home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I have a dog.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you ever had any allergies to any pets or animals?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any exposure to fumes or dust uh, with where you live?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and do you have any past medical history? Any diagnoses?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I um, I just have the osteoarthritis.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Osteoarthritis, okay. Is that why you're taking the?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And are you taking any other medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I take uh, Advil.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Advil, okay. Any allergies that you know of?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, any previous hospitalizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I had my wisdom teeth removed. But no, I wasn't, I wasn't hospitalized.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, is that the only surgery that you've had, or have you had anything else?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah. No, that's it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any family history of any lung or heart conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any cancers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, breast cancer, my grandma had it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, any uh, and currently, what's your living situation like, do you live with someone?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I live with my husband.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: And my dog.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And your dog, okay. And did your husband tell you anything, like that has changed in your behaviour at all uh, recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: He just said that I was, I was just extremely drowsy yesterday and I was very hard to wake up.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Okay, um, do you smoke currently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you smoked in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and do you work currently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh I, I do.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And uh, how would you, sorry, dis you say you don't work or do you work?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'm a banker, but I'm working virtually, uh, remotely right now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. And um, do you use any recreational drugs like marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I um, no. Well sometimes I'll use marijuana for the pain, but I haven't been doing that recently, for the past two months.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay. Um, how, how often would you say you use it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Only when the pain gets uh, too bad, so maybe um, three or four times a month.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, and do you use any alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, yeah, I'll, uh, I'll drink once a week, two glasses, two or three glasses of wine.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, any, alright, so I think that those are all the questions I have for you today. Do you have any questions or concerns for me?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, so yeah, definitely with the coughing and shortness of breath we will definitely get a COVID swab test done. Um, that should come back in the next 24 to 48 hours and then public health will contact you. Um, yeah, based on what you're telling me so far, we will definitely do a physical examination, get your vitals, and get your oxygenation and everything done. But I also think, since you were very drowsy and were, had fallen asleep and were really difficult to wake up, sometimes you can get what's called aspiration pneumonia. Um, and that's, that can also be a possibility and what we will do is get a chest x-ray, get some blood work done as well today. Um, now we may require antibiotics, and if your vitals unstable we might actually admit you as well. Um, does that sound good?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, so yeah, we'll get those tests done and we'll be there with you shortly. We'll also get like an EKG done as well.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
